middleware.name: core-make
middleware.desc:
Core Make build system provides the make build files and scripts for building and programming ModusToolbox™ applications. Builds can be run either through a command-line interface (CLI) or through ModusToolbox™ Integrated Development Environment (IDE).
Additional Information:
  • Core Make build system README.md
  • Core Make build system RELEASE.md

middleware.name: cat1cm0p
middleware.desc: CAT1A and CAT1C Arm® Cortex®-M0+ prebuilt images enabling flash write services and Bluetooth® Low Energy event handling.

middleware.name: cmsis
middleware.desc: CMSIS for PDL: The Common Microcontroller Software Interface Standard (CMSIS) is a vendor-independent abstraction layer for microcontrollers that are based on Arm Cortex processors. CMSIS defines generic tool interfaces and enables consistent device support. The CMSIS software interfaces simplify software reuse, reduce the learning curve for microcontroller developers, and improve time to market for new devices. CMSIS provides interfaces to processor and peripherals, real-time operating systems, and middleware components. CMSIS includes a delivery mechanism for devices, boards, and software, and enables the combination of software components from multiple vendors.

middleware.name: mtb-pdl-cat1
middleware.desc: The Peripheral Driver Library (PDL) integrates device header files, startup code, and low-level peripheral drivers into a single package.

middleware.name: mtb-pdl-cat2
middleware.desc:
The Peripheral Driver Library (PDL) simplifies software development for Category 2 devices. The PDL integrates device header files, startup code, and low-level peripheral drivers into a single package.
Additional Information:
  • CAT2 Peripheral Driver Library README.md
  • CAT2 Peripheral Driver Library RELEASE.md
  • CAT2 Peripheral Driver Library API reference guide

middleware.name: mtb-pdl-cat5
middleware.desc: The Peripheral Driver Library (PDL) integrates device header files, startup code, and low-level peripheral drivers into a single package.

middleware.name: mtb-xmclib-cat3
middleware.desc: The XMC™ Peripheral Library (XMC™ Lib) consists of low-level drivers and CMSIS startup code for the XMC™ product family peripherals.

middleware.name: mtb-xmc-emeeprom
middleware.desc:
The XMC™ Emulated EEPROM middleware emulates an EEPROM device in the XMC™ device flash memory. This allows you to store nonvolatile data with more flash resiliency.
Additional Information:
  • Em_EEPROM Middleware Library README.md
  • Em_EEPROM Middleware Library RELEASE.md
  • XMC EEPROM Middleware Library API reference guide

middleware.name: mtb-hal-cat1
middleware.desc: PSoC™ 6 Hardware Abstraction Layer package, provides a set of APIs to initialize, configure, and use the PSoC™ 6 MCU resources using the ModusToolbox™ Hardware Abstraction Layer.

middleware.name: mtb-hal-cat2
middleware.desc: PMG & PSoC™ 4 Hardware Abstraction Layer package, provides a set of APIs to initialize, configure, and use the PMG/PSoC™ 4 MCU resources using the ModusToolbox™ Hardware Abstraction Layer.

middleware.name: mtb-hal-cat4
middleware.desc: 43907 Hardware Abstraction Layer package, provides a set of APIs to initialize, configure, and use the 43907 MCU resources using the ModusToolbox™ Hardware Abstraction Layer.

middleware.name: mtb-template-cat1
middleware.desc: CAT1 BSP template files for the BSP Assistant Tool.

middleware.name: mtb-template-cat2
middleware.desc: CAT2 BSP template files for the BSP Assistant Tool.

middleware.name: mtb-template-cat3
middleware.desc: CAT3 BSP template files for the BSP Assistant Tool.

middleware.name: mtb-template-cat4
middleware.desc: CAT4 BSP template files for the BSP Assistant Tool.

middleware.name: recipe-make-cat1a
middleware.desc: PSoC™ 6 Make build recipe provides the make files and scripts for building and programming PSoC™ 6 applications.

middleware.name: recipe-make-cat1b
middleware.desc: 20829 Make build recipe provides the make files and scripts for building and programming 20829 applications.

middleware.name: recipe-make-cat1c
middleware.desc: XMC7000, Traveo II Make build recipe provides the make files and scripts for building and programming XMC7000 and Traveo II applications.

middleware.name: recipe-make-cat2
middleware.desc:
PSoC™ 4 Make build recipe provides the make files and scripts for building and programming PSoC™ 4 applications.
Additional Information:
  • CAT2 Make build recipe README.md
  • CAT2 Make build recipe RELEASE.md

middleware.name: recipe-make-cat3
middleware.desc: XMC™ Make build recipe provides the make files and scripts for building and programming XMC™ applications.

middleware.name: recipe-make-cat4
middleware.desc: 4390X™ Make build recipe provides the make files and scripts for building and programming 4390X™ applications.

middleware.name: scl
middleware.desc: The SCL library enables the network stack runing on the customer processor(CM4) to communicate with the network processor(CM0P) on CYSBSYSKIT-01 board.

middleware.name: scl-mtb-integration
middleware.desc: Library to translate Wi-Fi Host Driver (WHD) APIs to Subsystems Communication Layer (SCL) APIs for CYSBSYSKIT-01.

middleware.name: bmi160
middleware.desc: Bosch BMI-160 Sensor Driver.

middleware.name: bmm150
middleware.desc: Bosch BMM-150 Sensor Driver.

middleware.name: littlefs
middleware.desc:
A little fail-safe filesystem designed for microcontrollers. Choose the mtb-littlefs under PSoC™ 6 Middleware that will also download this library. The mtb-littlefs implements the block device drivers necessary for using a littelfs on the Infineon MCUs. A littlefs is hosted in a GitHub repository external to the Infineon organization on GitHub.

License Disclaimer:
Adding this library will download and add littlefs to your project. It is your responsibility to understand and accept the littlefs license.
Additional Information:
  • littlefs home page

middleware.name: mtb-littlefs
middleware.desc:
The Block Device drivers for use with a littlefs filesystem.
License Disclaimer:
Adding this library will also download and add littlefs to your project. It is your responsibility to understand and accept the littlefs license.

middleware.name: pdstack
middleware.desc: USB Power-Delivery Stack comprehending Type-C connection detection, PD protocol layer and Policy Engine.

middleware.name: pdutils
middleware.desc: USBPD Utility middleware providing software timer and utility functionality.

middleware.name: qistack
middleware.desc: Wireless Charging Qi Specification stack comprehending Object detection, FSK/ASK, Policy Engine and Policy Manager

middleware.name: wlchpi
middleware.desc: Wireless Host processor Interface

middleware.name: CCGxAppCommon
middleware.desc: Common Application Code base for CCGx Based Products

middleware.name: ml-inference
middleware.desc: The ModusToolbox™ ML Inference Engine library is a set of pre-compiled libraries which provide easy to use API's to run ML workloads on embedded platforms. This library works with the files generated by the ModusToolbox™ ML Configurator GUI, supports optimized kernels and various quantization levels.

middleware.name: ml-middleware
middleware.desc: The ModusToolbox™ ML Middleware library provides helper functions to simplify integration of ML models. The library also includes functionality to support streaming validation data on the embedded target.

middleware.name: emfile
middleware.desc: SEGGER emFile - A FAT16/32 filesystem for embedded systems supporting SPI NOR flash and SD card.

middleware.name: ml-tflite-micro
middleware.desc: The ml-tflite-micro library is a pre-configured TensorFlow tflite-micro runtime library for the Infineon PSoC6™ platform.

middleware.name: p64_utils
middleware.desc: Secure Boot Utilities Middleware Library is a set of utility code for PSoC™64 device performing operations like providing an interface to Secure FlashBoot SysCalls including PSA cryptographic functions, generic syscall functions, base64 decode provisioning JWT packet, parsing JSON data, policy parsing helpers, dynamic memory manager.

middleware.name: trusted-firmware-m
middleware.desc: Trusted Firmware-M (TF-M) implements the Secure Processing Environment (SPE) that aligns with the guidelines outlined by Platform Security Architecture (PSA) for secure devices. TF-M provides a set of secure services conforming to the PSA functional API. The secure sevices provided include PSA Crypto, PSA Secure Storage, and PSA Attestation.

middleware.name: lin
middleware.desc:
The LIN Middleware Library implements a LIN 2.2 and ISO 17987 compliance slave node.
Additional Information:
  • LIN Middleware Library README.md
  • LIN Middleware Library RELEASE.md
  • LIN Middleware Library API reference guide

middleware.name: sensor-xensiv-pasco2
middleware.desc: This library provides functions for interfacing with the XENSIV™ PAS CO2 Sensors. By leveraging photoacoustic spectroscopy (PAS), XENSIV™ PAS CO2 overcomes the size, performance and assembly challenges of existing CO2 sensor solutions. This library can be setup to use the ModusToolbox™ HAL interface, or using user provided communication functions.

middleware.name: sensor-xensiv-bgt60trxx
middleware.desc: This library provides functions for interfacing with the XENSIV™ BGT60TRxx 60GHz FMCW radar sensors.

middleware.name: xensiv-radar-sensing
middleware.desc: This library provides APIs to interface with the RadarSensing library that allows user to use existing radar applications such as presence detection, entrance counter or build applications on top.

middleware.name: optiga-trust-m
middleware.desc: Software Framework for the OPTIGA™ Trust M security solution

middleware.name: retarget-io-cat3
middleware.desc: The Retarget IO (CAT3) library provides APIs for transmitting messages to or from the XMC™ 1000 or XMC™ 4000 board via standard printf/scanf functions using a UART connection which is generally connected to a host machine.

middleware.name: capsense
middleware.desc:
Capacitive sensing solution (CAPSENSE™) enables a variety of applications such as touch, gesture and proximity detection for home appliances, automotive, IoT, industrial applications, and more. A CAPSENSE™ supports multiple interfaces (widgets) using both Self-Capacitance (CSD) and Mutual-Capacitance (CSX) sensing methods.
Additional Information:
  • CAPSENSE™ Middleware Library README.md
  • CAPSENSE™ Middleware Library RELEASE.md
  • CAPSENSE™ Middleware Library API reference guide

middleware.name: emusb-device
middleware.desc:
emUSB-Device has been designed to work on any embedded system with a USB client controller. It can be used with USB 1.1 or USB 2.0 devices.
Additional Information:
  • emUSB-Device home page
  • emUSB-Device User Guide & Reference Manual

middleware.name: emusb-host
middleware.desc:
emUSB-Host is a CPU-independent USB Host stack. emUSB-Host is a high-performance library that has been optimized for speed, versatility and small memory footprint.
Additional Information:
  • emUSB-Host home page
  • emUSB-Host User Guide & Reference Manual

middleware.name: ble-mesh
middleware.desc:
The Bluetooth® LE Mesh middleware libraries and included adaptation code allows user to create LE Mesh applications for PSoC™ 6 + 43012 Bluetooth®, CYW920829M2 chips. Components included are binaries for Mesh Core, Mesh Models and Mesh Provisioner libraries and adaptation code to create mesh applications.
Additional Information:
  • Bluetooth® LE Mesh library README.md
  • Bluetooth® LE Mesh library RELEASE.md
  • Bluetooth® LE Mesh library API reference guide

middleware.name: btstack-integration
middleware.desc: The btstack-integration middleware library provides Bluetooth porting layer component for PSoC™ 6 targets.

middleware.name: mbedtls
middleware.desc:
ARM mbedTLS library is an implementation of the TLS and SSL protocols and the respective cryptographic algorithms. mbedTLS is an open source TLS/SSL library which has cryptographic capabilities. Using this library in a project will cause mbedTLS to be downloaded on your computer. It is your responsibility to understand and accept the mbedTLS license and regional use restrictions (including abiding by all applicable export control laws).
Additional Information:
  • Mbed TLS Library Information

middleware.name: mbedTLS Acceleration
middleware.desc: CAT1A, CAT1B and CAT1C MCUs acceleration for mbedTLS library.

middleware.name: multi-half-bridge
middleware.desc:
This C++ library provides APIs for interacting with Infineon's Multi Half-Bridge ICs. This family of devices is designed for DC motor control applications.
Find more information in the library repository.

middleware.name: csdidac
middleware.desc: IDAC, implemented in the CSD hardware block, to provide regulated current source.

middleware.name: csdadc
middleware.desc: ADC, implemented in the CSD hardware block, for voltage measurements.

middleware.name: device-db
middleware.desc: Device database provides device information for project-creator, configurators, and other tools.

middleware.name: mtb-matter
middleware.desc:
This library provides the configuration and makefiles needed to build the matter library. The matter library is extracted from the official Matter repository - https://github.com/project-chip/connectedhomeip, and is the minimal number of files needed from that repository.
Additional Information:
  • MTB Matter Library README.md

middleware.name: matter
middleware.desc:
This library is the essential files extracted from the official Matter repository - https://github.com/project-chip/connectedhomeip.
Additional Information:
  • MTB Matter Library README.md

middleware.name: matter-wifi
middleware.desc:
This is an empty library that just serves to allow the appropriate connectivity dependencies (wifi, thread, etc) to be pulled in with the matter and mtb-matter libraries.
Additional Information:
  • MTB Matter Library README.md

middleware.name: cmsis-dsp
middleware.desc:
CMSIS DSP software library is a suite of common signal processing functions for use on Cortex-M processor based devices. Choose the sensor-dsp under PSoC™ 6 Middleware that will also download this library. CMSIS DSP is hosted in a GitHub repository external to the Infineon organization on GitHub.

License Disclaimer:
Adding this library will download and add CMSIS DSP to your project. It is your responsibility to understand and accept the CMSIS DSP license.
Additional Information:
  • CMSIS DSP home page

middleware.name: sensor-dsp
middleware.desc:
The Sensor-DSP library provides signal processing functions required to support the implementation of different sensor applications, e.g. radar gesture recognition, vital sensing and presence detection. The Sensor-DSP library builds on top of the standard ARM® CMSIS-DSP library.
License Disclaimer:
Adding this library will also download and add CMSIS DSP to your project. It is your responsibility to understand and accept the CMSIS DSP license.

middleware.name: xensiv-radar-presence
middleware.desc: The XENSIV™ Radar Presence Detection library detects both macro and micro movements in a configurable range.

middleware.name: lz4
middleware.desc:
LZ4 is lossless compression algorithm, providing compression speed > 500 MB/s per core, scalable with multi-cores CPU. It features an extremely fast decoder, with speed in multiple GB/s per core, typically reaching RAM speed limits on multi-core system LZ4 library is hosted in a GitHub repository external to the Infineon organization on GitHub.

License Disclaimer:
Adding this library will download and add LZ4 library to your project. It is your responsibility to understand and accept the LZ4 license.
Additional Information:
  • LZ4 home page
